title: Getting ready for the 2024 elections
selftext: The selection committee to consist of the PM, Cabinet Minister of PM's choice and Leader of opposition. The odds are already 2:1. We know what to expect when they remove the CJI out of the committee to appoint the CEC right before the elections. SC had recommended this, but who gives heed to the SC?
comments: Could anyone elaborate how removing this power from the CJI can benefit the country's election procedures???   There must be some logical reason right ?
The recent judgement was because there was no law for this. SC ordered what it did to be applicable till parliament makes a law. So technically there isn't much of a change

What? 

Correct me if I'm wrong but it used to be the unilateral decision of just the PMO? 

CJI was never included in the decision making by the Supreme Court in 2015. The CJI isn't even an elected authority.

This bill makes the current system of including the opposition party leader much much much better than what we had for 75 years.
